rules_summary: Capture attention within the first 2-3 seconds of the video to prevent viewers from scrolling away.
Use bold visuals and engaging content right at the start to hook viewers.
Introduce the key message or proposition within the first 5-10 seconds.
Text overlays should be used to reinforce key messages and ensure clarity, especially in sound-off environments.
Maintain a fast pace with quick cuts to sustain engagement, particularly on platforms like TikTok and Instagram.
Employ a rhythmic pattern of visual changes every 3 seconds to keep the video dynamic.
Use captions or text overlays to emphasize crucial information and facilitate understanding for viewers without sound.
Ensure that the video narrative aligns with the quick cuts and pacing to prevent confusion.
Consider using sound effects and music to complement quick visual changes, enhancing the emotional impact.
Craft content with the assumption that viewers may initially watch without sound, thus the visual storytelling must be compelling.
Video ads on Facebook and Instagram should focus on delivering clear messages quickly due to brief attention spans.
Align the video length with platform norms — shorter for platforms like TikTok, possibly longer for YouTube.
three_three_three_definition: Implement the '3-3-3' heuristic by changing visual elements, text, or rhythm approximately every 3 seconds to avoid viewer fatigue.
Visual changes could involve shifts in camera angle, subject focus, or graphical elements.
Text overlays should refresh periodically to maintain viewer interest and highlight new information.
The rhythm of the video, informed by editing pace or musical beats, should evolve consistently to keep energy high.
This method aims to maintain engagement through constant and engaging visual or auditory updates.
hook_0_2_rule: The initial 0-2 seconds are critical for capturing viewer attention in videos, especially on social media platforms.
Use visually striking or surprising elements immediately to draw viewers in and encourage them to continue watching.
Starting with a question or a bold statement can effectively intrigue the audience early.
Animations or motion graphics can add appeal in the first seconds to hook viewers.
Avoid starting with logos or branding; instead, start with captivating content.
Ensure the first second visually communicates the video’s essence or value proposition.
Experiment with novel editing techniques like reversed action or sped-up segments at the outset.
Content should be tailored to provoke curiosity or an emotional response to secure continued watching.
pacing_editing_rules: Apply quick cuts and diverse scenes to maintain viewer engagement, especially critical in short videos.
Each scene should last no more than 3-5 seconds to avoid losing audience interest.
Use accelerated pacing in narrative and content delivery to match the fast nature of short-form content.
Vary the speed of cuts in line with the story to create emotional highs and lows.
Integrate music tracks with perceivable beats to guide the rhythm of edits and maintain flow.
Stagger visual intensity; build up and abruptly reduce to keep viewers attentive.
Combine static images with dynamic video to create textual or graphical breaks.
Blend live-action with animated elements to keep the visuals lively and captivating.
Edit the video to ensure coherence despite rapid cuts; maintain the narrative arc.
Pacing should match the platform's norms; TikTok can handle faster paces compared to YouTube.
Employ looping in edits to give content rewatchability and emphasize key points.
Opt for chromatic changes or filters every few seconds to introduce new visual flavors.
Strategically time pauses or stills for dramatic effect within a backdrop of fast pacing.
Incorporate user-generated content style clips to create relatability and fresh visual cues.
